comments:
Eclipse 200311050952
OS X 10.3 on Dual G5

When the 'show source of selected element only' state is unchecked - completion works perfectly.

However, when 'show source of selected element only' state is checked there are two reproducible 
errors:

1. If you select the class, so the whole class is visible in the editor, then selecting an item from a 
list of possible completions adds the selected item, but puts the cursor several lines below where it 
should. There are no stack traces in the logs.

2. If you select a method and then select a completion from the list, a stack is produced:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 4 Nov 14, 2003 10:29:58.101
!MESSAGE Unhandled exception caught in event loop.
!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 Nov 14, 2003 10:29:58.102

ContentAssistSubjectAdapter::setSelectedRange sets the selection on the widget,
but CompletionProposalPopup.insertProposal fills in the model offsets it gets
from the completion proposal.

Investigating.

Hi Tom,
I've just tried Eclipse 20031118 and the problem still exists for me. Did you mean the fix will be in 
the next version after this ?

channing

it went into the repository yesterday night, so it didn't make it into the
nightly build... Should be working in today's (20031119) and will certainly be
in M5 due this friday.
